intro: Bupleurum plantaginifolium, commonly known as the common valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported sedative properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
